alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued August 31 at 1:34PM PDT until September 01 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE SMITH RIVER AND SLATER BURN SCAR IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall will be possible over the Smith River and Slater burn scars. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Del Norte Interior. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Smith River and Slater burn scars with rainfal rates at or above a half inch per half hour will be possible during the period of the watch. Residents near the Smith River and Slater burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
